alert.note: Alert for West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 26 at 2:31PM PST until March 01 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST MONDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM MONDAY TO 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and strong winds expected. Blizzard conditions Monday morning through Tuesday night. Total snow accumulations 1 to 2 feet lower elevations with 4 to 7 feet higher elevations. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Western Plumas County/Lassen Park. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 4 AM PST Monday. For the Blizzard Warning, from 4 AM Monday to 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be extremely dangerous to impossible with extended road closures likely. Blowing snow will cause white- out conditions at times. Downed trees and tree limbs with power outages are possible due to heavy snow and gusty winds. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels 2500 to 3000 feet this evening falling to 1000 to 2000 feet Monday into Tuesday. Periods of heavy snow this evening with snow showers lingering into Sunday night. Very heavy snow is expected Monday into early Wednesday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park
